title: How long should an outline be? - Quora

response.answer_text: That depends on what you are outlining. A book? An essay? An outline for a book is going to be longer than an outline for a 5 paragraph essay. You want to cover the main points for each section. For a book, it may be In Chapter 1, main character finds him/herself with a problem. Chapter 2, the character decides how to deal with that problem, or adds complicating factors, and so on. As in Character on the run finds out that his brother has been taken prisoner. Character wants to rescue his brother. In Chapter 2, Brother is being held in place X, however, the character is heading for place Y, in the opposite direction, to get the evidence or part of the evidence to clear his name- and he has a time window to get there that makes it impossible for him to rescue his brother. Chapter 3, Character has friends who may be able to help him free his brother, but Character wants to rescue his brother himself… and so on. Outlines need to have enough information that you can write what you need to and see where you need to go next in your writing.

Depends on the assignment. Are you writing a 5 paragraph essay? A 5 page essay? An outline is a list of the main points and the sub points. For every A you need a B. You can also have C, D, E and so forth. The process of outlining helps you organize your thoughts. As an example, you could say as your thesis statement: My favorite thing is mail boxes. I like them because the keep communication open with my family, they let me conduct business, and I like the surprise of opening the box like a present every day. That would be points A, B, and C. Then you will want at least 2 subpoints under each of the 3 points. For example: a) I like writing to my sister because… b) I like writing to my mom because … The length of an outline depends on the length and complexity of your topic.
